> A few questions, in case documentation does not yet exist.

Documentation does not yet exist. :)

> Does this mean the end of xml crawl orders?

Yes. We're planning a tool for converting 1.x order.xml files to 2.x  
settings, but there's no timeframe on that yet. In the meantime let  
us know if you need help converting an order file to 2.x.

> Is the structure deeper than key-value pairs?

Yes and no. The order of the pairs is important; you can't define a  
setting for root:foo:bar until root:foo is defined.

> Have the underlying settings changed much? At first glance it would
> appear not.

Not really. The biggest change here is that many modules now  
explicitly advertise that they depend on other modules. For instance,  
in 1.x, FetchHTTP would retrieve the ServerCache from the global  
CrawlController; in 2.x, FetchHTTP has a separate ServerCache  
setting. We did this so that the modules could be used in other  
applications without requiring all of Heritrix's infrastructure.

In most cases the values for these new module settings are deduced  
automatically by the settings framework, so hopefully you won't have  
to worry about them. They are all listed in the Web UI and module  
documentation though.

Otherwise the settings should be the same. Eg, FetchHTTP:timeout- 
seconds does the same thing as in 1.x.

-Paul
